body_html:
@peterjc123 Can you please point me to how this gen.py is supposed to be invoked? I know that it is from CMake somehow, using the cwrap_files variable, but I'm not sure how exactly the full invocation is supposed to work from setup.py --> ? --> aten/src/ATen/gen.py. I must apologise but I have very little experience with CMake itself.

One other thing, I was looking at the output console from your CI builds, and I notice you're using Ninja there. In order to try and completely replicate what I am doing, could you please try performing a fresh build on your own machine without using Ninja or clcache? Here are the exact steps which I am doing on my side:

  1. Open VS2017 x64 Native command prompt (same errors if you use x86_x64 prompt)
  2. git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
    cd pytorch
    xcopy /Y aten\src\ATen\common_with_cwrap.py tools\shared\cwrap_common.py
  3. set NO_CUDA=0
  4. set CUDA_PATH=%CUDA_PATH_V8_0%
  5. set CMAKE_GENERATOR=Visual Studio 14 2015 Win64
  6. set LIB=[PATH_TO_BLAS_LIBS];%LIB% // I use MKL 2018 libs here
  7. set PYTHON_VERSION=3.5
  8. set DISTUTILS_USE_SDK=1
  9. python setup.py bdist_wheel

If you do all of that, are you able to replicate my errors?
body_text:
@peterjc123 Can you please point me to how this gen.py is supposed to be invoked? I know that it is from CMake somehow, using the cwrap_files variable, but I'm not sure how exactly the full invocation is supposed to work from setup.py --> ? --> aten/src/ATen/gen.py. I must apologise but I have very little experience with CMake itself.
One other thing, I was looking at the output console from your CI builds, and I notice you're using Ninja there. In order to try and completely replicate what I am doing, could you please try performing a fresh build on your own machine without using Ninja or clcache? Here are the exact steps which I am doing on my side:

Open VS2017 x64 Native command prompt (same errors if you use x86_x64 prompt)
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
xcopy /Y aten\src\ATen\common_with_cwrap.py tools\shared\cwrap_common.py
set NO_CUDA=0
set CUDA_PATH=%CUDA_PATH_V8_0%
set CMAKE_GENERATOR=Visual Studio 14 2015 Win64
set LIB=[PATH_TO_BLAS_LIBS];%LIB%      // I use MKL 2018 libs here
set PYTHON_VERSION=3.5
set DISTUTILS_USE_SDK=1
python setup.py bdist_wheel

If you do all of that, are you able to replicate my errors?
body:
@peterjc123 Can you please point me to how this gen.py is supposed to be invoked? I know that it is from CMake somehow, using the cwrap_files variable, but I'm not sure how exactly the full invocation is supposed to work from setup.py --> ? --> aten/src/ATen/gen.py. I must apologise but I have very little experience with CMake itself.

One other thing, I was looking at the output console from your CI builds, and I notice you're using Ninja there. In order to try and completely replicate what I am doing, could you please try performing a fresh build on your own machine without using Ninja or clcache? Here are the exact steps which I am doing on my side:

1) Open VS2017 x64 Native command prompt (same errors if you use x86_x64 prompt)
2) git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
    cd pytorch
    xcopy /Y aten\src\ATen\common_with_cwrap.py tools\shared\cwrap_common.py
3) set NO_CUDA=0
4) set CUDA_PATH=%CUDA_PATH_V8_0%
5) set CMAKE_GENERATOR=Visual Studio 14 2015 Win64
6) set LIB=[PATH_TO_BLAS_LIBS];%LIB%      // I use MKL 2018 libs here
7) set PYTHON_VERSION=3.5
8) set DISTUTILS_USE_SDK=1
9) python setup.py bdist_wheel

If you do all of that, are you able to replicate my errors?
